hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed High-Volume Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a high-volume (>1.5x 20-day avg) price breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound that fails to sustain for 4 consecutive hours and closes back inside the band will be followed by a mean reversion move into a BEARISH regime within the next 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, liquidity is often trapped. A high-volume breakout that immediately fails signals strong rejection by larger participants, exhausting bullish momentum and often triggering a liquidation cascade as late longs exit. The high RSI confirms overbought conditions ripe for reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h candle closes above 20-day BB upper band on volume > 1.5x 20-day avg
Subsequent 4h candle closes back INSIDE the BB (price <= BB upper)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 20-day BB lower band OR regime shifts to BEAR (confidence > 65%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes > 2% above the failed breakout high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If > 55% of such signals are followed by a successful breakout (price > breakout high within 48h) or the regime transitions to BULL instead of BEAR.
